title: Add WASD and arrow key controls to all games

requirements.summary: Update SnakeGame to accept both WASD keys (W=up, A=left, S=down, D=right) and arrow keys for directional movement, allowing both control schemes to work simultaneously
acceptanceCriteria: Snake responds to W key for up movement
Snake responds to A key for left movement
Snake responds to S key for down movement
Snake responds to D key for right movement
Snake continues to respond to all arrow keys
Both WASD and arrow keys can be used interchangeably during gameplay

file_operations.description: Extend the handleInput method to accept both WASD keys and arrow keys for directional control. Map 'w'/'W' to up, 'a'/'A' to left, 's'/'S' to down, and 'd'/'D' to right, while preserving existing ArrowUp, ArrowLeft, ArrowDown, and ArrowRight key handling. Ensure both control schemes can be used interchangeably without mode switching.

requirements.summary: Update PongGame to accept both WASD keys (W=up, S=down) and arrow keys (ArrowUp, ArrowDown) for paddle movement, allowing both control schemes to work simultaneously
acceptanceCriteria: Pong paddle responds to W key for upward movement
Pong paddle responds to S key for downward movement
Pong paddle continues to respond to arrow up and arrow down keys
Both WASD and arrow keys can be used interchangeably during gameplay

requirements.summary: Update the GameControlsOverlay component to display both WASD and arrow key controls for each game in the controls dialog
acceptanceCriteria: Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Snake
Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Pong
Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Breakout
Display format clearly indicates both control schemes are available

file_operations.description: Update the controls array in each game's metadata (Snake, Pong, and Breakout) to include both WASD keys and arrow keys. For Snake, add 'W/↑', 'A/←', 'S/↓', 'D/→' alongside or replacing the existing arrow key descriptions. For Pong, add 'W/↑' and 'S/↓'. For Breakout, add 'A/←' and 'D/→'. Ensure the format clearly indicates both control schemes are available for each action.

Update the controls rendering logic to properly display combined WASD and arrow key notations from the updated gamesCatalog. Ensure the key badge rendering handles the dual notation format (e.g., 'W/↑') and displays it clearly to users, making it obvious that both control schemes work simultaneously.
